pull.title: Bugfix: chainparams: Add missing (always enabled) Taproot deployment for Signet
pull.body: Is there a way we can trigger compiler warnings if a deployment is undefined?

events.body: I didn't try, but in theory the deployment params are going to be uninitialized and could be anything?
taproot is already activated on global(?) signet? how to activate manually on my own custom signet?

events.message: Bugfix: chainparams: Add missing (disabled) Taproot deployment for Signet

events.body:
@kallewoof @ajtowns are you ok with having taproot always active on signet?

@luke-jr Can you update the PR title as it's no longer disabled.

rename.from: Bugfix: chainparams: Add missing (disabled) Taproot deployment for Signet
rename.to: Bugfix: chainparams: Add missing (always enabled) Taproot deployment for Signet

events.body:
> @kallewoof @ajtowns are you ok with having taproot always active on signet?

Yep!

Master:

```
==2885080== Thread 23 b-qt-rpcconsole:
==2885080== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==2885080==    at 0x3F94F4: BIP9SoftForkDescPushBack(UniValue&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, Consensus::Params const&, Consensus::DeploymentPos) (blockchain.cpp:1220)
==2885080==    by 0x3F8E11: operator() (blockchain.cpp:1357)
...
```

Checked that this pull fixes the uninitialized read and also prints:

```
    "taproot": {
      "type": "bip9",
      "bip9": {
        "status": "active",
        "start_time": -1,
        "timeout": 9223372036854775807,
        "since": 0
      },
      "height": 0,
      "active": true
    }
```

comments.body:
I think the ideal behaviour might be to have it always active on the default global signet, but optional for custom signets. Without the ability to disable it for custom signets, it's not possible to make a custom signet that behaves the same as mainnet.

Something like https://github.com/ajtowns/bitcoin/commit/4ceae373743043fac372a27244538a2ee64d0295 perhaps
Well, testnet/regtest already have a way to configure these in the config file... maybe just copying/sharing that logic?
`-vbparams` is regtest-only, and I think more general than we'd want for something on signet. (I don't think signalling activations on signet is ever actually useful, in particular)
Made it always active for now. Adding a new option for custom signets goes beyond a bugfix.
